title: Account for fluoride ion smaller than oxide ion

content.prompt: Which of the following best helps to account for the fact that the F- ion is smaller than the O2- ion?

choices.label: F- has a larger nuclear mass than O2- has.
F- has a larger nuclear charge than O2- has.
F- has more electrons than O2- has.
F- is more electronegative than O2- is.

skill.text: 4.A: Predict and/or explain chemical properties or phenomena (e.g., of atoms or molecules) using given chemical theories, models, and representations.
